text: {{Infobox writer | name = Carey Harrison | image = | caption = | birth_date = | birth_place = Kensington, London, England | death_date = | death_place = St. Leonards-on-Sea, East Sussex, England | education = Sunningdale School Harrow School Jesus College, Cambridge | occupation = Novelist, playwright, radio dramatist | spouse = | children = 4 | parents = Rex Harrison Lilli Palmer | website = | imagesize = 200px }} Carey Harrison (19 February 1944 â€“ 22 January 2025) was an English novelist and dramatist. He also wrote television screenplays such as The Jensen Code (1973) and Freud (1984). His father was actor Rex Harrison. ==Death== Harrison died at his home in St. Leonards-on-Sea, East Sussex on 23 January 2025, aged 80. ==Novels== *Freud (1984) *Richard's Feet (1990) *Cley (1991) *Egon (1993) *How To Push Through (2002) *Dog's Mercury (2005) *Who Was That Lady? (2005) *Justice (2005) *Personal Assistant (2006) *Clear To Kill (2006) *As An Unperfect Actor on the Stage (2006) ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1944 births Category:2025 deaths Category:English novelists Category:English television writers Category:Writers from London
